ygData.subject: Re: GZ answers
ygData.msgSnippet: I hardly think I am high up on GZ s favorites list.  As it took him nearly 2 months to reply to this.  I sent him the  first draft of these questions back in
ygData.messageBody:
I hardly think I am high up on GZ's favorites list. As it took him nearly 2
months to reply to this. I sent him the first draft of these questions
back in mid november. The anfter posting it on the Sony EQ board it had to
be bump nearly 300 times before abashi even acknowledged it.

Rokenn


>From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqbards] GZ answers
>Date: Thu, 6 Jan 2000 15:45:47 -1000
>
>Rokenn,
>
>Since you were able to get a response from Abashi and GZ, you might want to
>send them a reminder for when they fix the percussion aspect of Furfil's
>Curtailing Chant. Lets assume after they code the fix equipping a drum
>will
>now increase the damage of the DOT and the amount of magic resistance the
>mobs loses. I think we should remind them to remember the MM battle drum
>when they code the fix. Singing Furfil's with the MM battle drum equipped
>should increase the DOT and magic resistance amount 20% (I think thats what
>everyone says it increases resist songs by) more than with a normal drum
>equipped. Based on their track record, if we don't remind them they will
>probably forget about including the MM battle drum as part of the patch.
>
>Galtin of E'ci
>
> > >>>Fufil's Curtailing Chant and the other Chant songs, The percussion
> > aspect
> > >>>of these songs is broken. Using a drum produces no additional effect
> > >>>(damage or resistance debuff).
> >
> > ***GZ SAYS***
> > Hmm - don't use that one much. I'll check. If so, we'll get it fixed
>right
> >
> > up.
> > **************
> >
